TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Procurement of parallel framework agreements for consultancy services for NAV.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: The aim of the procurement is to establish parallel framework agreements that can be used to obtain necessary external competence for NAV.

The contracts shall cover the need for competence that the contracting authority does not have access to in its own department on a given day, or where there is an independent need for external task solving. The contracts can also be used if extra capacity is needed.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Full recruitment process of key personnel and of managers from office manager level and higher levels.
Parts of the recruitment process of key personnel and of managers from office manager level and higher levels, such as
Consultancy services for the recruitment process
Assistance with process improvements and quality assurance for recruitment.
Advice on methods and systems for physically securing personnel from threats and violence.
Advice on the prevention, handling and follow-up of violence and threats of violence.
Advice on the design of buildings and furnishings that fulfil NAV's requirements for its employees' safety.
Advice, project management and project support connected to:
— entity development and continual improvement in implementation and change methods;
— analysis/review and evaluation of the organisation, including consequences and gains work;
— organisation design, work processes, roles and responsibility;
— advice, methods and tools within strategic competence work — development, management and mapping.
Strategic competence management, including the use of and interaction between procurement, development, restructuring and discontinuing measures.
Development and adaptation of competence measures with the main emphasis on e-learning/digital learning (action support and competence sharing).
Organisation and personnel analyses, including obtaining and comparing data, analyses and decision bases.
— Development of management groups and teams;
— Measuring/following-up managers, including systems, tools and methods (360 manager evaluations).
— Development of manager programmes, talent programmes and mentor programmes.
— Project management tool, for example MS Project
ITIL; expertise within Service Management and work processes within ITIL's framework
Method within system development and administration.
— Document handling, including journal/archive, document production, document distribution and receipt/scanning.
— Information and data architecture, including master data management
— Rule architecture, including rule engine tool
— Independent quality assurance, for example, of technical architecture, systems, infrastructure, functional requirements for architecture and technology, processes/security.
— Test management and technical roles connected to testing (performance testing, automising tests, test data etc.) including strategy and plan.
— Test competence within technical tests (performance, security and interruption tests).
— Operation and management of Oracle eBusiness Suite;
— Set up of system, functional and technical competence;
— Interface, for example, for handling invoices.
— Data warehouse, Business Intelligence, for example, Actuate, Business Objects, Informatica, SAS.
— Web development, further development of applications and interface.
— Analysis and design: analyse description and data modelling (for example UML, Rational S/XDE, ERWin).
— Programming: Component based and construction (for example Java, j2EE, Eclipse, WSAD5.1, Cobol, C/C++, Visual Basic, Oracle PL/ SQL).

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Operation of IT systems and platforms

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Operation, production and troubleshooting (for example HPUX, Solaris, Red Hat Linux, Z/OS, windows client and server, Cisco, PCP / IP, Oracle, DB2 for Z / OS, DL/1, VSAM, ARS-remedy, CA-Unicenter, IBMs TWS)
Expertise within IN-services, IP-telephony, PABX-systems and mobile systems.
Spesialists in Citrix Xen App, Unix, Red Hat Linux
Expertise within design and architecture for data storage.
Design, construction development tools, tuning (for example DB2 for z/OS, DL/1, VSAM, Oracle)

Design, operational competence, competence transfer, architecture and configuration work for middle layer software (For example: MQSeries, TP-Monitor / CICS / Cobol, WebSphere Application server, WebLogic Application server, XML, J2EE / JCA / CTG / JMS / JAAS, JMX, LDAP, Websphere Process Server, JBoss Application server, DataPower, Oracle FORMS, JBoss Enterprise service bus, SonicMQ).
Cisco: Router Switch, security, content Switching, Wireless LAN, Cisco Works
Trend Micro virus Software, IMSS, IESS, eManager
Technical expertise in technologies and protocols such as TCP, IP, Frame Relay, MPLS, SMTP, SNMP, VPN, VLAN and OSPF
General network technology: Debugging Windows network problems and debugging IP network using a sniffer tool.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The contract period is 2 years from contract signing. The contracting authority (the customer) has the option to extend the contract for an additional up to 1+ up to 1 year.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: The tenderer is required to be a legally established company.
— Norwegian service providers: Company registration certificate from the Brønnøysund Register Centre.
— Foreign service providers: Certificate for registration in the Register of Business Enterprises as prescribed in the legislation of the state in which the provider is established.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: The service provider is required to have good financial solidity. A ‘good creditworthiness’ or better credit rating satisfies this requirement.
— The contracting authority will obtain a credit rating carried out by Experian; see www.experian.no
If the service provider feels that the credit rating will not provide an accurate picture, please send supplementary information together with the qualification application.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Relevant experience from similar assignments is required.
The service provider's 3 most important contracts in the last 3 years per competence area that the service provider is applying to be pre-qualified for, including:
— The contract's extent (value and/or number of invoiced hours)
— The service provider's function/area of responsibility.
— Name and contact information of the contact person at the reference customer so that NAV can contact them if needed.
— A short description of the contract/project. The service provider's contribution shall be clearly stated.
The template in the qualification documents' annex 2 shall be used.
This point shall be responded to per competence area that a request for participation is submitted for.
A good, efficient quality assurance system is required.
— An account of the company's quality assurance system/management system, including a system for the development and maintenance of competence.
— Any certificates issued by independent bodies.
